image.altText: Silhouettes of young people dancing, arms out to the side with pink downlighting in the background.

props.synopsis: Not everyone has fond memories of their high-school formal, which is particularly true for many LGBTQIA+ people. It's that experience that inspired Darwin's first ever 'Queer Youth Prom' as part of Pride Month.

title.children: Queer youth come together for inclusive 'prom' they never had

image.altText: Two police officers blurred in the background, wearing high-vis jackets. Red siren on top of police car in foreground

props.synopsis: Northern Territory Police are investigating the accidental drowning of a four-year-old boy in a backyard swimming pool on Saturday afternoon.

title.children: NT Police investigating 4-year-old's drowning in backyard pool

image.altText: Lamb cutlets on a bed of rosemary in front of national flags.

props.synopsis: Australian producers are fetching "phenomenal" prices for lambs as overseas customers buy record amounts.

title.children: Record prices for Aussie lamb as export demand surges

image.altText: A cowboy standing in front of horse stalls and smiling.

props.synopsis: A belt buckle seems like a cowboy staple, but not just anyone can wear it. Beyond the Beyonce-inspired 'fits, here's the real Top End cowboy culture.

title.children: 'It's just so free': Life as a cowboy in the remote Top End

image.altText: a man wearing an official khaki uniform

props.synopsis: The NT's corrections commissioner says there's been a "substantial" amount of lockdowns across territory prisons in recent months, due to record inmate numbers and staff shortages.

title.children: Lockdowns 'all of the time' across NT prisons, as inmate numbers soar

image.altText: A photo showing a white dog with black spots behind a cage.

props.synopsis: Animal shelters in the NT are facing a crisis as more and more pet owners surrender their animals due to cost of living pressures. Advocates say stricter regulations on backyard breeding could ease the burden.

title.children: Shelters 'overwhelmed' as owners struggle to afford keeping pets

image.altText: A close up shot of a man wearing a chequered shirt.

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory is about to become only the second jurisdiction in Australia to allow people to carry and use pepper spray, but the laws might be stricter than you think.

title.children: 'Misguided': Peak Aboriginal health body slams NT pepper spray trial

image.altText: Clear plastic containers stacked together each carrying something that appears light brown in colour.

props.synopsis: Fiji watched closely as witnesses in the nation's largest-ever drugs trial gave evidence revealing the alleged details of a meth operation.

title.children: 'I was scared': Witnesses testify after record four tonne Fiji meth haul

image.altText: police in camouflage search a suburban area

props.synopsis: The man who allegedly assassinated a US senator and attempted to kill another had a list of dozens of different targets in his car, police say.

title.children: Minnesota assassin had list of 70 potential targets, police say

image.altText: Photo of All Are Welcome bakery window with a building reflected in the glass.

props.synopsis: The ABC reported in recent days staff at the three inner-Melbourne All Are Welcome bakeries were owed $243,000 in superannuation and $125,000 in leave entitlements.

title.children: Popular bakeries close their doors with staff owed super, leave

image.altText: Charlie Curnow looks up towards his left

props.synopsis: A perfect first-half for Carlton is soured by Charlie Curnow limping off the ground as West Coast coach Andrew McQualter offers a harsh assessment of his team's performance. Follow live.

title.children: Blues star Curnow under fresh injury cloud as coach blasts 'pathetic' Eagles

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Curnow officially subbed out with 'calf tightness'
Reid in hot water over swinging arm

image.altText: Toby Sexton and Lachlan Galvin run

props.synopsis: The Canterbury-Bankstown Bulldogs held on to beat the South Sydney Rabbitohs 24-18 on a wild Sunday night NRL clash at the Olympic stadium, that featured a 30-minute lightning delay.

title.children: Bulldogs survive storm delay and brilliant Bunnies fightback to claim victory

image.altText: A landscape showing steep rock formations rising up out of hilly bushland.

props.synopsis: When Hyun Park slipped while climbing in the Warrumbungles, her life depended on her 80-year-old mentor and the tactical gymnastics of a 20-hour overnight rescue mission.

title.children: Remarkable 20-hour rescue of climber dangling unconscious 200m up a cliff

image.altText: Two bullet holes are seen in a property's window as yellow police tape is strung across the bottom of the frame

props.synopsis: An Australian man is dead in a shooting incident in Bali, local police say, with another injured Australian being treated in hospital.

title.children: Victim's wife details Australian man's death in Bali villa shooting

image.altText: A security camera in the foreground with a house behind it

props.synopsis: With crime rates a big concern for many Australians, households are increasingly turning to technology to try to protect against thieves.

title.children: Do home security cameras deter thieves?

image.altText: Albanese

props.synopsis: Australia's closest ally is giving a spirited impression of behaving like a cantankerous bear ahead of G7 summit in Canada.

title.children: Albanese shelters with the herd as Trump's grizzlies lash out

image.altText: A truck unloading rubbish at Woodlawn landfill.

props.synopsis: Energy from waste is common around the world, and there are almost a dozen plants now in operation or being proposed across Australia — but with the opportunity comes other problems.

title.children: As Australia embraces energy from waste, perceptions are changing

image.altText: Mature woman drinking water from a bottle while exercising.

props.synopsis: The "silent disease" of osteoporosis is expected to lead to one fracture in Australia every 30 seconds by 2033. We talked to experts about how to keep your bones healthy for as long as possible.

title.children: 'Tsunami of osteoporosis': Building strong bones needs to start early

image.altText: Penny Wong during cabinet meeting

props.synopsis: The foreign minister warns the Israeli and Iranian governments to show restraint, while avoiding comment on the legality of Israel's strikes on Iranian military and nuclear facilities and the world's largest gas field.

title.children: Wong says Israel has right to self-defence, but urges restraint as Iran pounded

image.altText: illustration of father and child in the style of Da Vinci's Adam and God

props.synopsis: Some of Australia's largest IVF clinics have passed inaccurate information about children born from sperm donations to their male donors.

title.children: Sperm donor Mark met his biological kids. Then the clinic found a mistake

image.altText: Donald Trump speaks into a microphone in front of American flags and gold curtains.

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese will meet with Donald Trump in what the PM says will be a "constructive discussion" on tariffs and the AUKUS submarine pact.

title.children: Albanese to meet Trump at G7 talks in Canada

image.altText: A photo of Dr Mo examining a child during one of his missions to Gaza.

props.synopsis: Mohammed Mustafa recently returned from his second medical mission in Gaza, describing horrific conditions. Now, the Australian doctor is on a mission to build an Australian-backed children's hospital to help save lives.

title.children: What Australian doctor saw in Gaza was 'apocalyptic', now he wants to go back

image.altText: South Africa captain Temba Bavuma holds the mace trophy aloft as he walks around Lord's after the World Test Championship final.

props.synopsis: Across four days at Lord's, Temba Bavuma's team shows history, both distant and recent, can be overcome by a group brimming with talent and resilience.

title.children: South Africa ditches 'chokers' tag to win World Test Championship

image.altText: Richardson Hitchins fights George Kambosos in New York.

props.synopsis: Australian fighter George Kambosos is comprehensively beaten by IBF super lightweight champion Richardson Hitchins in Madison Square Garden, after Aussie heavyweight claims major scalp.

title.children: 'If you love your son, you should stop this fight': Kambosos loses title fight

image.altText: An aerial picture of Point Cook's skyline, with rows and rows of homes and Melbourne's CBD in the background

props.synopsis: A council in one of Melbourne's growing outer corridors is facing criticism for diverting funding away from a region where locals are calling for more basic infrastructure.

title.children: Backlash after Melbourne council redirects funding from growing suburb

image.altText: Jess Fox on podium with fellow World Cup medallists in France.

props.synopsis: Three-time Olympic champion Jess Fox tops the podium at the latest leg of the ICF Canoe Slalom World Cup circuit in Pau, France.

title.children: Fox wins more World Cup gold in France

image.altText: Qld Police video 3

props.synopsis: Seven men from New South Wales with alleged links to a Middle Eastern crime network have been charged with abducting a Queensland man behind a gambling investment company.

title.children: Police allege NSW bikies threatened to kill man over $2.4m debt

image.altText: The royal family appear on Buckingham Palace's balcony and look up towards the sky

props.synopsis: King Charles III wore a black armband at the Trooping the Colour military parade as a mark of respect for the victims of the Air India plane crash.

title.children: Royals unite for Trooping the Colour as King Charles honours Air India victims

image.altText: Aerial view of flooded roads and bridges.

props.synopsis: A temporary water solution remains in place weeks after flooding at Wingham in northern NSW, highlighting the vulnerability of Australia's aging water infrastructure.

title.children: NSW town still relying on 'high-risk' water fix after record floods

image.altText: A Parliament House in the early morning sun.

props.synopsis: Tasmania's snap election has encouraged more candidates to step forward, with former senior Liberal Elise Archer, union leader Jessica Munday and ex-Salmon Tasmania's Luke Martin to run, among others.

title.children: Ex-Liberal, unionist, ex-salmon boss hopefuls for Tasmanian election

image.altText: A blue question mark fridge magnet on a coral background

props.synopsis: Be warned, this spelling test is like no other!

title.children: Word nerd? Grammar guardian? Try your hand at our spelling quiz

image.altText: Ange Green dances with her daughter Annabeth, or AB, at their Dalby home.

props.synopsis: It took Ange Green months to feel connected to her baby girl. She couldn't understand why she fiercely loved her nephews, but didn't yet feel the same way about her own daughter.

title.children: Mum captures moment she first connected with baby with help of Taylor Swift

image.altText: People swimming in a gorge.

props.synopsis: The Kimberley is a land defined by its extremes: a wild climate, harsh terrain and remarkable biodiversity. Join Mark Coles Smith as he guides us on a journey through this extraordinary part of the world.

title.children: 'I couldn't believe my eyes': Witnessing the spirit of Country in the Kimberley
